https://www.nytimes.com/2014/04/07/nyreg.abstract: Barely more than half of the 10,000 New York City buildings burning heaviest, cheapest forms of heating oil have switched to cleaner fuel, three years into a four-year plan to phase out dirtier oils; expense of boiler conversion is a major obstacle, and city can ultimately take landlords to court to force the conversion; city officials say despite only partial success, New York City has experienced its best air quality in 50 years.
